document_title: Chronic kidney failure: Causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Chronic kidney disease often progresses silently, without specific symptoms until the final stage. Therefore, an important goal is to detect the disease early in 3 high-risk subjects: people with diabetes, hypertension and a family history of kidney disease. These subjects need to have annual screening tests and early active treatment to avoid the disease progressing to end-stage chronic kidney failure.
Besides, to prevent chronic kidney disease, leading to kidney failure, each person needs to pay attention to:
Follow instructions about taking over-the-counter medications. When using pain relievers such as aspirin, ibuprofen, acetaminophen... you should follow the instructions on the packaging. Taking too many pain relievers over a long period of time can lead to kidney damage.; Maintain a reasonable weight. If you are at a healthy weight, continue to maintain it with appropriate physical activity. If your weight exceeds the standard, you should talk to your doctor about healthy ways to lose weight.; No smoking. Because toxins from cigarettes can damage the kidneys and make existing kidney damage worse; Manage risk factors such as diabetes, high blood pressure...; Build a healthy diet by limiting foods rich in salt, sugar, oil, etc. Increase the addition of vegetables and fruits to your daily menu. Drink enough water (about 2 liters/day). (4)

With the leading modern machinery and equipment system in the country and the region; Operating room meets international standards; Along with a 5-star boarding area and high-class service... The Urology and Nephrology Center stands out with examination, screening and treatment services for all urinary tract diseases. From common surgeries to major high-tech surgeries. These include laparoscopic kidney stone surgery, kidney transplant, tumor resection to preserve kidney parenchyma; Radical nephrectomy; Radical prostatectomy; total bladder resection and small bowel cystoplasty; adrenalectomy; shaping urinary tract defects... Diagnosis - medical and surgical treatment of all male diseases.

Call hotline 0287 102 6789 (HCMC) or 024 3872 3872 (Hanoi) to register for a private medical appointment with a specialist, through customer service staff.; Register for a medical appointment with any doctor you trust at the link: https://tamanhhospital.vn/danh-cho-khach-hang/dat-lich-kham/; Send a message on Tam Anh General Hospital Fanpage or Tam Anh General Hospital Urology and Andrology Fanpage; Text message via Zalo OA of Tam Anh General Hospital.
Chronic kidney failure is one of the serious diseases that can appear at any age and greatly affects the patient's health. Therefore, early detection and treatment is very important in improving treatment effectiveness, saving costs and minimizing complications, especially avoiding the risk of death.
